item.title: Report X-2025071032
item.description:
Report X-2025071032

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-10
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE GROUND PACKAGE THAT WAS UNDELIVERABLE TO THE CONSIGNEE. UPON INSPECTION FOUND (1) PACK OF (50) NEON GAS LIGHTERS INSIDE FILLED WITH FLUID. NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING SHIPPER NUMBER G012Y8, WHICH IS NOT A VALID UPS SHIPPER NUMBER. THE PACKAGE WAS BEING RETURNED BECAUSE THE CONSIGNEE ADDRESS WAS NOT A FULL AND VALID ADDRESS. THE THERMAL LABEL SHIPPER IS A TO Z DISTRIBUTORS, 4614 N MACARTHER BLVD, WARR ACRES OK 73122.

item.title: Report X-2025070758
item.description:
Report X-2025070758

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-07
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE GROUND PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED AFTER THE PACKAGE WAS RETURNING DUE TO NO SUCH CONSIGNEE ADDRESS. UPON INSPECTION FOUND TWO CONTAINERS OF ZIPPO LIGHTER FUEL, EACH AT 12 OZ (355ML) CAPACITY FOR A TOTAL OF 24 OZ INSIDE THE UNMARKED BOX. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE. THE UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER USED IS G012Y8 WHICH IS NOT A VALID UPS ACCOUNT. THE THERMAL LABEL SHIPPER IS A TO Z DISTRIBUTORS, 4614 N MACARTHUR BLVD, WARR ACRES OK 73122.

item.title: Report X-2025070667
item.description:
Report X-2025070667

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: APPROXIMATELY 700 GROUND PACKAGES ARRIVED AT THE CENTER USING AN INVALID UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER OF G012Y8. THE ACCOUNT NUMBER HAS BEEN USED THE LAST MONTH FOR PREVIOUS UNDECLARED FLAMMABLE GAS UNDECLARED SHIPMENTS. SOME OF THE PACKAGES ARE FIBERBOARD BOXES AND OTHERS ARE MANILLA PADDED ENVELOPES. ALL OF THE PACKAGES CONTAIN FLAMMABLE GAS ITEMS. SOME OF THE PACKAGES CONTAIN AMERICAN FUEL ZIPPO BUTANE AT 250 ML AND OTHERS CONTAIN ZIPPO LIGHTER FLUID REFILL CANS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report E-2025070432
item.description:
Report E-2025070432

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-19
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2:51 AM ET, LTU contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Glenpool, OK. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of White Vinyl Lacquer Undercoater, which released from a 1-5 gallon metal pail due to being loaded onto a pallet with a nail protruding, causing a puncture in the container. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill and place the waste into a 30 gallon plastic drum.

  • Description: FIFTY-FOUR GROUND PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO PREVIOUS UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING FOUND. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A 10.14 OUNCE NEON BUTANE LIGHTER REFILL IN SOME PACKAGES. OTHER PACKAGES HAVE ONE 9.8 OUNCE ZIPPO BUTANE LIGHTER REFILL. SOME PACKAGES ARE A FIBERBOARD BOXES AND SOME ARE IN A PAPER ENVELOPES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER PACKAGES.

  • Description: GROUND DECLARED LEAKING HAZMAT.PACKAGE WAS A SINGLE WALL UN SPECIFIED FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINING 2 PAPER CARTON BOXES WHICH CONTAINED 1 PLASTIC 5 LITER BOTTLE EACH. PACKAGE WAS FOUND ACTIVELY LEAKING. PACKAGE WAS WET AND THERE WAS SPILLED LIQUID AROUND PACKAGE. ONE CONTAINER WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP.

item.title: Report X-2025051328
item.description:
Report X-2025051328

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: TULSA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the TULR location a handler observed a cloud coming from a fiberboard box. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered a metal canister labeled and UN1977 liquid nitrogen. It was packaged with styrofoam molds top and bottom but the outer fiberboard box was missing DG markings and paperwork required for transit. The shipment is being held at the location for the FAA.

item.title: Report I-2025060220
item.description:
Report I-2025060220

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-05
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENLEY OIL COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The cleanup crew arrived onsite. The spill area on the concrete sidewalk was approximately 4' x 8' and along the curb for approximately 20'. The diesel fuel had migrated along the curb and then a small amount entered a storm drain. It was reported that approximately two (2) table spoons of diesel fuel had exited the storm drain and into the river. The site personnel had cleaned up most of the concrete. The crew sprayed MicroBlaze on the spots of diesel and then placed clay absorbents down and worked them around with brooms. The absorbents were collected and placed into a 55-gallon drum. Site personnel had placed absorbent boom across the river to catch floating sheen.
